page.title: 07MALTING END
page.content: Malting End consists of a row of Council houses and several other houses and bungalows, mostly modern. It gets its name from the former GREAT MILL nearby, which was one of four corn-grinding mills in Wickhambrook, none of which is now in existence. Some of the Great Mill buildings are now used as a bakery and HQ of a fleet of electrically driven mobile shop vans. The Baker is a real expert and one of his specialities is baking harvest loaves for the three village Churches (United Reformed, Methodist and Anglican). M. End was once the "centre" of Village life for the Post Office and Bank and General Shop were all here (now Old Post Office, Bank House and Commerce House - this last a fine 3-storey thatched building.)
